channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @KenSmith that's a good line! ;-)

1/3 I connected with people on Twitter's developer relations team today. They had a conference call that I dialed into, and the conversation turned to devs big wish for the Twitter API, that we organize the code so that from a browser-based app you can communicate directly with
2/3 twitter, without having to run a server app as an intermediary. This has always been a big opportunity, but now there's communication. I've been developing apps using the Twitter API since 2006, and this is the first time I've had a conversation with developers at the
3/3 company. Real progress. There's *lots* of untapped potential here, Twitter's service is an incredible network resource, and there are many millions of users. Lots to do, and I already have a next step in mind. As they say, still diggin! üòç
@mikeyanderson I see -- no it's Node.js.
@mikeyanderson what is RoR
@SarahSquirm @willmenaker The Departed.
Please stop calling everything breaking news. https://t.co/OE2c20IPYN
Humility + Arrogance. https://t.co/fz8czBzPB8
Ford wants to sell EVs online only and at a set price. https://t.co/9mwMK1IzIB
@estherschindler 76244,120
Trump's Raffensperger call is 'incredibly strong evidence' to support criminal charges: former US attorney. #obvious https://t.co/y4JxRaXoXE
@StevenTDennis It is a demo of how crazy this is. https://t.co/TNqVElT3fz
@randsinger that's a weird way to ask the question. let's just say i found out. ;-)
All the news boils down to this scene from Harry Met Sally. https://t.co/nIf1PBdKUC
@Strandjunker As did the Democrats by letting them get away with blocking the Garland nomination.

I'm thinking about releasing https://t.co/KAVhNd06pG as open source. It was the browser-based twitter app I wrote back in 2014 so it's really simple internally. If you think it's a good idea let me know. Esp if you're a developer or aspiring developer.
One thing you could do is publish articles like substack does, except instead of sending them out as emails you could publish them as twitter threads.
I'm working my way through Atlanta and loving it. In season 2 now, just watched the episode with the weird guy in the mansion with the piano. https://t.co/xXUjfnGCyM
ammosexuals https://t.co/upbq5pVSZR

Celtics or Warriors?
How Omicron Infection Turbo-Charges Vaccinated People‚Äôs Immunity. https://t.co/UPTZv40JeV

@LouisAnslow @AdamSinger I agree. But I was thinking about tech today.
https://t.co/KAVhNd06pG makes writing a thread like writing an email.
Buick is rebranding as an electric-only automaker. https://t.co/UYCg2ysULM
